data.event: Mother's Day was founded in Grafton on May 10, 1908; the city is the home to the International Mother's Day Shrine.

event.title: was situated where the City of Grafton, West Virginia is today

data.event: When James Current traded a horse for 1300 acres of virgin land in Virginia it was situated where the City of Grafton, West Virginia is today.
In 1751, he hired George Washington to first act was to stake his property.
Grafton is near what may be called the headwaters of the Monongahela River, which now form in the lee of the Tygart Valley Dam.
The Tygart Valley was first settled by Europeans in 1753 when David Tygart (for whom the valley and river are named) with his family.
